website_summaries.verdict: Unfinished wood offers a natural surface for birds to perch, play, and gnaw on.
pros: Wide, flat upper surface allows birds to stretch their feet and rest securely
Rounded bottom with bark is ideal for chewing
Natural fir is safe and comfortable to perch on
Sturdy hardwear delivers a secure fit
Suitable for all bird breeds and fits most medium to large cages
cons: Removing and reattaching the perches when it’s time for a thorough cage cleaning can be a hassle

customer_reviews.title: My baby cockatiels love it
customer_reviews.text: I recently adopted two baby cockatiels, and they love sleeping on this perch. They're still working on developing their little feet and legs for proper perching and climbing, so I think the flat surface gives them a safe and secure place to rest (that's not on the bottom of the cage). I just ordered a second one to put a little higher up on the other side of the cage. The perch itself is solid and very well-made for the price!
customer_reviews.author: magickitty

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, nice size, sturdy, looks good, & my baby seems to like it :)
customer_reviews.author: Anj

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: This perch looks pretty durable. I was expecting it to be smaller, but this is actually a pretty good size for birds/small animals.
customer_reviews.author: Lissette Perez

customer_reviews.title: Comfy perch
customer_reviews.text: My white cap pionus is getting older so I wanted to give him a platform to roost on. He loves it and has personalized it with his whittling. The bark in the edge was trimmed off.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: It is a nice addition to her cage and she loves to sit ...
customer_reviews.text: My quaker parrot, Gracie, loves her little wooden perch. It is a nice addition to her cage and she loves to sit up on it and watch the world go by. Whether I have it installed with the bark side up or down, this perch is wonderful for another surface for her little toes besides a traditional round dowel-style perch. It is very important to give your parrot different size perches in order to keep their little feet healthy, and this is a wonderful alternative! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Toni M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price
customer_reviews.text: My African grey loves this perch. The attaching hardware is kind of cheaply made but considering the price of other perches it's not surprising. And cost is definitely a factor here because he takes about 2 days to totally destroy the perch. (That's what it's for, no?) Anyway I was kind of hesitant because it is from China but the wood had no odor and was smooth without any splintered edges. I have paid a whole lot more for comparable perches. They don't last long so to me it is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Napolitano

customer_reviews.title: Birdie LOVES this perch
customer_reviews.text: Our cockatiel loves this perch. He sleeps on it all night. Because he is getting older, he needs a bit more support and THIS was the answer. He used to sleep in his food dish. I made him a teepee, but he liked it for a while and now does not. I got this perch for him and he is super happy with it. I had to buy a second one because he loves this perch so much in his "mansion." We have a huge caged home for him... when he's not enjoying our company and flying around the house to his other favorite day time perches. Thank you for this.... nice bark for him to chew on too!!!
customer_reviews.author: Florida Hillbilly

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: Love these for my birds. Gives them a nice spot to rest their feet. I’ve got a 8 year old cockatiel that LOVES this perch. It’s her favorite spot in the cage. I have had this perch for quite a while now and it’s still holding strong. Very sturdy. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: A toy to destroy and a perch
customer_reviews.text: We have 4 budgies that share a big cage. We always put new perches and toys outside their cage so they can get used to it without being forced to interact with it. This one took 2 weeks for them to start to go near it. Once they did, they all discovered how much they love peeling off the bark, pecking at it and even just perching on it. I moved it inside their cage a few days ago and if they’re inside their cage, one of them is usually on it. Now that the bark is mostly peeled off, I’m going to buy another set soon with new bark because they loved destroying it so much!
customer_reviews.author: L777s

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly perfect
customer_reviews.text: I've bought 6 of these so far, 3 sets of 2. The reason I keep buying them is that my parakeets and lovebirds love sitting on them and hanging out and I love that it gets them off of their perches. Birds get arthritis when sitting on the same size perch every day and it's important for the health of their feet to have a variety of perches available. My lovebirds prefer sleeping on these over their nest and they all enjoy picking at the wood. I will be buying more of these, as I'm working to have them all the way around my cage. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Beavers

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Product
customer_reviews.text: I would never purchase this product again. The price was certainly right, but as far as functionality goes, I still have not been able to get it into the cage. When I first attempted, the bolt end of the attachment fell out of the wood. It had not been secured at all. I used some super glue to fix the bolt in place. However, in the process, I lost the screw eye. I've tried to use others of similar size, but the threading seems off. To date, my disabled Amazon parrot still does not have his flat perch in his cage. Super disappointed! Pamela Clark, CPBC, CVT
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Clark, CVT

customer_reviews.title: Only good for small non distructive birds
customer_reviews.text: First the disc that comes with the screw is so cheap it bends an doesn't stay..this is only good for small birds..this lasted 15 minutes in my African grey cage..she tore it up that fast. I put a second one in an same results. I purchased some double headed screws an purchase untreated wood cut the wood into five by five inches put two screws in each side an as of today it's still standing an my bird loves it...so if your crafty, make your own.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Sanger

customer_reviews.title: My cockatiels LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness. My 2 cockatiels LOVE these perches. They sit on them all day long and sleep on them. Here are a couple of tips. * The bottom part of the perch will shed, so don't place it under any food or water bowls like I did. The shedding will go away in a few days as the birds peck on it. * Bird poop is super easy to clean. Use a wet paper towel or one of those Magic Eraser Sponges and scrub, for tougher poop, squeeze a few drops of water on it and then scrub and dry with a paper towel. I'm going to order more soon. I really like these.
customer_reviews.author: Aleena.A

customer_reviews.title: Will purchase again
customer_reviews.text: I placed it on the bottom of the cage because my parrot would not step on it when I attached it to the bars. I didn't want to throw it out. After ignoring it for about a month he decided to pick at it. He whittles it down a little every day. I am glad because it keeps him busy and I figure his beak is conditioned.
customer_reviews.author: abc

customer_reviews.title: Decent perch if you get one that will tighten.
customer_reviews.text: Received my first order, very nice perches, good size, but the eyebolts were loose inside of the wood and completely fell out. I tried to caulk them back in, but the wingnuts would not tighten. They would spin for eternity and never tighten onto the washers. the seller sent me 2 new ones, but the same thing. I caulked the eyebolts back in and only 1 of the 4 I received managed to tighten enough so that the perch did not wiggle. I will go to the hardware store and see if I can get better hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Desirai

customer_reviews.title: My 2 cockatiels love them
customer_reviews.text: My two cockatiels love them. They sit on them for long periods of time, even with quite a nice selection of other perches. The male is eating away the bark, but even without the bark, they are still nice and sturdy. I've had them for over a month now and they are just as good as the first day. Even washed them a few times.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia Olawella

customer_reviews.title: Good Perch
customer_reviews.text: My Caique uses this perch at night for sleeping. He uses the textured side as there is a slight curve and texture from the bark. Just a note, the bark does flake off quite a bit and you will notice it at the bottom of the cage. He chews on it here and there. It’s his favorite perch in the cage. This flaking would not prevent me from purchasing this again. He likes it. It is important to have different styles and sizes of perches to help prevent or deal with arthritis in their feet. Highly recommended it.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie

customer_reviews.title: It's better than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my little pine squirrel to perch on and hoped it wouldn't be to small. It's actually bigger than I expected and he sits very comfortably on it! It's very sturdy and gives him somewhere to sit, chew or hang for from it! I'm almost thinking about another set!
customer_reviews.author: Ma Hen

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: Almost Junk- Screw breaks loose, Bird could Injured
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the package of two. Great value so we thought. However what value is there to something that is junk and cannot be attached for its intended purpose. The two long metal screws that are inserted into the wood, after trying to tighten the wing nut to the bars, came loose. I tried to retighten, but screws both eventually fell out. I have now put two helpings of different glues in and around the inserted screw. Remains to be seen if this will work. Why do some Amazon sellers sell junk to loyal customers !?
customer_reviews.author: Murray Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Cockatiel loves it
customer_reviews.text: My cockatiel loves it. He has a disabled foot so finding comfortable perches for him now is important as he is getting older and he tends to fall more and his foot bothers him. But a recommendation you may want to glue the screw bolt inside the wood perch as mine fell out the first time I tried to screw it on his cage.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha Moyer

customer_reviews.title: Great for all birds!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 3 packs of these now, I think. I originally bought them because I adopted a one-footed parrot, and wanted to make sure he had plenty of perching options. My other parrots enjoy them too! I also use them in some of their travel cages. Sometimes I put the flat side up, sometimes I put the rounded bark side up. They won't last forever though, one of my caiques immediately ripped off most of the bark, but he has been chewing on his for awhile and I haven't had to replace it yet. Great value! Will buy more.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Give Your Bird’s Feet a Rest!
customer_reviews.text: Needed an alternative to round perches to give my bird’s feet a rest and to unclench, which helps to decrease later arthritis. I like to flip it around so the sanded surface is under and the rounded surface in on top, and they love it! I have two Green Cheek Conures and they fit/sleep perfectly on it. Picture attached.
customer_reviews.author: S E P

customer_reviews.title: My Female Parakeet ....
customer_reviews.text: Mine love's this !! As soon as I attached it, with the bark side up... She went right to work taking off the bark lol The male parakeet is not really interested. She stacked the piece's of bark in one spot. I guess she was building a nest ?? IE The past couple of times, the washer's and all will not tighten- up or the screw fall's out : I I just hate to see this product go, my bird's love it so much.............
customer_reviews.author: ringydingy1

customer_reviews.title: Not made for birds and with thoughts of making it last.
customer_reviews.text: Poorly made. Metal rod goes only 1 inch into wood. Wood is soft. As bird picks on wood it falls right off of the metal holder. Mine broke off of the metal holder in a couple of weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Ren

customer_reviews.title: Great perch.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a caique with a bad foot...she has almost a club foot. This work quite well for her. She can perch on normal perches but this let her rest her good foot when she needs too. This is pretty much her favorite perch. I put this one up highest in her cage for her.
customer_reviews.author: lorimartow

customer_reviews.title: So nice!
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned when I opened them because they smell like cedar. After a lot of research they aren’t cedar and *seem* to be safe. I put one in my Quakers cage and one in my parrotlets cage. They’ve been in there since December and it’s now almost March. So far they both love them, nibble on the bark, and stand on them a lot. It’s probably a nice relief from standing on perches! Highly recommended and the price was really good when I purchased them!
customer_reviews.author: Jesi

customer_reviews.title: Just as pictured.
customer_reviews.text: These two perches are fine and are sturdy when properly placed. My budgies don't like them for some reason. They have been in the bird cage for weeks and they haven't stepped foot on them. I even took one out and moved the other one to another location in the cage. Still nothing. They don't smell like anything, so it can't be that. I'll remove them if I see that are not being used.
customer_reviews.author: won of one

customer_reviews.title: Received the item broken unable to properly ise
customer_reviews.text: This was my 2nd time purchasing this product. I opened it up to install it and the screw that goes into the wood fell out. It looks like whom ever put it together made the hole in the wood to big! I would like a refund or a perch that isnt actually BROKEN before I use it! My parrot can not even perch she slides off because it's barely holding in the wood!
customer_reviews.author: P. Zboray

customer_reviews.title: Best Perch in Show
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my young cockatiel Billie, put them in about a week ago. I placed them with the bark side up. He wont leave the thing for more than a few minutes. If hes not eating or climbing he is on this perch. This is where he watches tv, dances, and sleeps. Kinda wish I could have these set up as a subscription because it looks like I'll be buying new ones on a regular basis.
customer_reviews.author: John D

customer_reviews.title: Nice platform for my Cockatiels
customer_reviews.text: I have a few cockatiels, one is very old and she has trouble getting around in the birdcage, it is huge, and so I have strategically placed things like this around the cage about midway up so she can move around a little safer. This item really helps her and it is better for her to sleep on as she has a hard time on a perch anymore. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Sallie Mae

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for my parakeet
customer_reviews.text: I put some moleskin on the surface to soften it because my parakeet has sore feet.. That is why I wanted a flat surface for him. When I attached this item, he would not go to it. So I put him on it, so that he would get the "feel" of it. Now he stays on it all the time - falls asleep on it even. I really like the item (and so does he)
customer_reviews.author: Bogwalker

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Someone gave this a bad review because they couldn’t find out what kind of wood it is and they thought pine which is toxic to birds. In the description it says it’s natural fir.
customer_reviews.author: Debra E. Linton

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase for a Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with my purchase. I ordered two more. It came with missing hardware, and the company was great in responding to my e-mail right away and mailing to me the needed items within a few days. I purchased the wooden platforms for a large cage with sugar gliders. It gives them a perfect platform to glide to and rest on. I will definitely order more from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Matylda

customer_reviews.title: Metal washers are too thin
customer_reviews.text: My african grey parrot likes the perch and the flat side is good for her feet. The only issue I have is with the metal washers. They are so thin that when I tighten the screw, the washer bends. The perch was still wobbly so I had to keep tightening it, the washer is crazy bent. Will see if it holds for a week.
customer_reviews.author: cards&crafts

customer_reviews.title: Great perch for Cockatiel
customer_reviews.text: My cockatiel loves it so much. She sleeps on it as well as sitting on it for a good amount of the day. She likes to pull at the bark too. Easy to wash too, just ran it under warm water and let it dry. Love this perch. Attached is a picture of my bird standing on it.
customer_reviews.author: Jake_K

customer_reviews.title: Great for parrot with leg/foot problems
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my older senegal parrot, with a one mangled toe that he can't grasp a round perch with. This is just the right size for him to sit and perch on so along with other types of platform perches and makeshift adjustments to his cage, he can make good use of his cage. There's the added benefit of having bark on the bottom/sides that he's started shredding off. He's a "chewer" so that's a plus!
customer_reviews.author: JO

customer_reviews.title: A good buy
customer_reviews.text: I put one of them so the flat side is up and the other with the slope up for variety. My budgie loves gnawing on the wood and also likes having her feet flat some of the time. It is a little awkward installing them and when I have to wash the cage I have to do it all over, but she's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: D. S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a handicap bird
customer_reviews.text: I have a handicap Finch his one foot had no toes on it. He perch but gets tired. This allows him to just rest he sleeps and naps on it. I am planning on getting them for my small mynah who suffered a broken leg in his previous home he sometimes has issues. I am getting some for my canary and other finches to give them a perch to stretch out their feet. Different size perches helps them have healthy feet.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Gibson

customer_reviews.title: The washers are HUGE (and that's a good thing)
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for a pair of cockatiels. They are perfect. A lot of the platforms you can buy have super tiny washers that slip through the bars if you aren't careful. These have huge washers that have absolutely no way of going through the bars so it makes it easy to install/uninstall.
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend! Great for our tiels, would recommend using better washers.
customer_reviews.text: My 2 tiels love these, especially ripping off the bark lol. They work perfectly for them. I didn't like the washers that came with them though. I used both together in the inside and a thicker wallet I already to the outside to help support them better. Other than that, they are great!
customer_reviews.author: Jayme Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I got these for ledges for my chinchillas, they are always climbing all over them. Fits our needs perfectly, will be ordering again.
customer_reviews.author: Brambalam

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I had to gorilla glue to screw into the ‘log’ (i covered the glued area to make it safe for my gliders) Very flimsily put together. Before my adjustments, these would turn from the weight of my sugar gliders, which barely weigh anything.
customer_reviews.author: Julacey Ceballos

customer_reviews.title: Great perch
customer_reviews.text: I have a bird that has a hard time getting a grip on round perches. This is great for him to be able to stand without pain. I do worry about the bark on the underside as most barks are not good for birds, but I removed it and am happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: ryan brady

customer_reviews.title: Useless screw, falling perch
customer_reviews.text: The screw does not stay in the perch. It just slides out. It held for about a week, then came in one morning to find the perch barely hanging on. I tried gluing it, but it didn't hold. Our bird loved to sleep on this, so I'm looking for an alternative. Such a shame.
customer_reviews.author: G. Frazier

customer_reviews.title: Threw it away 24hrs later
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t able to get this perch to really stay steady once I installed it. I also got a bit worried when I woke up this morning, and found that my Conure had peeled off a good portion of the wood! I wouldn’t suggest this product, nor do I trust it.
customer_reviews.author: Aksheltie

customer_reviews.title: Great perch
customer_reviews.text: I love these stands. Face it. You wouldn’t want to hang on to a stick all day. My bird stands on it to preen and she chews it up in shear joy. Wonderful perch for any small bird to small medium (like ring neck or cocktail)
customer_reviews.author: Palm Tree Villa

customer_reviews.title: Great perch!
customer_reviews.text: These perches are especially great for birds who like to perch flat-footed or don’t climb (I have a pigeon). I like both the natural bark side and the smooth side. I mostly use the smooth side because it’s easier to clean. There are no sharp edges so it is bird safe!
customer_reviews.author: Aliese

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: I installed one as a flat perch and the other one with the rounded side up, just for variety. These are high quality and very nice. $7.99 well spent for two of them, and I would purchase again. This is the second Niteangel product I've purchased and am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Perch for my Budgie
customer_reviews.text: My budgie is wild over this. She was wanting on it before I could even finish installing it. She likes the bark that is on the underside so I may end up flipping it around. It is very simple to install and is great quality. I was very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Kritnae

customer_reviews.title: Good for chewers
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy platform perch. Great for chewers who gnaw thru perches quickly. I changed out the rings with stainless steel units to be positive. The ones supplied were very thin. Great perches for little guys needing low flaky perches. My gcc is using one as his night perch.
customer_reviews.author: Ginny J

customer_reviews.title: Good deal! Peri Parrotlet approved!
customer_reviews.text: Great value. No issues. Parrotlet is using. I placed one flat side up near inner top section of cage... she perches on this one to rest. The second on is placed lower (on inside of door) with rough side up. Serves as a chew task and flight landing strip.
customer_reviews.author: ikaren312

customer_reviews.title: Unstable perch.  Wood is not dense enough to hold well.
customer_reviews.text: The bolt in the perch was loose because the wood is very lightweight. I tried to secure it to my cage but it would not tighten and hold making the perch unsafe. The bird loved it though so I purchased a better one from a denser wood elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Cindi Lund

customer_reviews.title: My parrot approves!
customer_reviews.text: My caique loves this perch! It provides a thicker spot for him to get comfortable at night, he prefers this over his more thin perches. He loves rubbing his beak on the bark as well. Its a softer bark that peels fairly easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: loves it
customer_reviews.text: I have a peach-faced lovebird and although he was sceptical at first he ended up loving this as a table for his seeds when he opens them. He also started peeling off the bark on the sides of the perch, which I'm fine with, I just didn't realize he would do that haha.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Hardware is stripped, I can't even hand tighten it without the big metal piece falling off. My bird jumped on this and fell down. Now I need to buy a hot glue gun to get this to stay together.
customer_reviews.author: Island of youth betta

customer_reviews.title: Toxic cedar
customer_reviews.text: This is a very strong smelling cedar perch. Cedar is TOXIC to pet birds. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: WS

customer_reviews.title: I thought he would like a flat space option for variety but he has ...
customer_reviews.text: The African Grey does not spend time on this perch. I thought he would like a flat space option for variety but he has only been on it once for about a minute. The perch is small. I had to buy larger washers for it to fit properly on the cage. I do not recommend this perch for African Grey parrots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Perch for Bigger Birds
customer_reviews.text: The company selling this product works hard for customer satisfaction. Just because of that you should give this perch a chance. The perch itself is great quality but it’s not made for little birds. From my two bigger birds, one did not really cared for it but the other loves it. He likes to sleep on it!
customer_reviews.author: Naomi H.

customer_reviews.title: Took some time but now they enjoy it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this perch for my 3 cockatiels to given them a different surface to perch on when they are in their cage. It took at least 2 weeks before they lost their fear of it! i placed some food treats on it now and then and finally they decided it wasn't a monster waiting to eat them. Now one always perches on it to sleep and they chew it as well. I like that one side has bark which they enjoy removing. Will buy again if this one wears out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for African Greys.
customer_reviews.text: I have an African Grey ... he just bit through the entire perch . I would say if you have a very temperament parrot do not buy this . The install was easy but not steardy ... it kept turning although it was tightened.
customer_reviews.author: Prince$$

customer_reviews.title: They are definately with the money..
customer_reviews.text: My Cockatiel loves these perches, they are big enough for her to stand on comfortably.. she's a big girl and I was hesitant they would be too small, but they are perfect, I would highly recommend these..
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Brick

customer_reviews.title: Wide Parrot Perch
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice perch that fits into small spots but is large enough for an Amazon Parrot to use it to rest their fat little feet. The washers could be larger if placing on a 1" wire-spaced wrought iron cage for larger birds. Otherwise they work well for smaller cages. Will be ordering more soon.
customer_reviews.author: Brunhilda

customer_reviews.title: I wish the birds liked it as much as I do.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful and well made, but the birds hate it. I put one in each cage, and they completely avoid or ignore it. (Sun conure, cinnamon green-cheeked conure, canary-winged parakeet)
customer_reviews.author: C E Bower

customer_reviews.title: My cockatiel loves to chew on it lol
customer_reviews.text: I think if I hadn't installed this in an area of the cage where it would be inconvenient for him NOT use the perch, my cockatiel might not use it as often. But what he does LOVE about this perch is chewing on the bottom bark part! We will see how long it lasts, either way, I definitely recommend this product and will buy again when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Bird approved!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my budgies and felt they needed a flat surface to rest their feet once in a while. They are on it all the time and seem to like it. And I also like the fact that they can use to to gnaw on too.
customer_reviews.author: dashPA

customer_reviews.title: my bird likes it even though it smelled like durian for a while
customer_reviews.text: It came with a strange scent, closest I can pinpoint was durian? My bird likes it though and makes sure to destroy the bottom part which is the woody side, not the flat side. I recommend this. It's pretty huge and heavy though, just a heads up for small cages and small birds.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Ng

customer_reviews.title: Great perch
customer_reviews.text: Great perch. I bought it for the flat surface. To give my Sun conure a place to perch on a flat surface. You know that birds need different sized perches for their feet. And a flat to stretch out their feet. It's not a hard wood, so mine chews it up pretty good. But still happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Fairholt

customer_reviews.title: Pretty lackluster, but might be ok.
customer_reviews.text: The screw fell out of the base the first time I tried to install it. Thank goodness it didn't fall under my birds. I'll drill another hole, and put some glue in the hole, but I did expect it to stay for a while.
customer_reviews.author: rachel murray

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I like these wooden perches. The extra perch is a bonus. I bought them for my ailing cockatiel who is now lame in one foot. He prefers them over others. He seems to prefer the curved, bark side.
customer_reviews.author: Checkmate

customer_reviews.title: one of them was not connected properly to the bolt
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of them, and one works great for my dove, she loves it, but the other I had to redrill into because the connective piece was not secured to the wood.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha A

customer_reviews.title: Seems to help with small parrot foot pain
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my senior citizen Conure (Maroon Bellied). She is having it appears foot issues. Anyway, she uses it as a perch. Seems to like it and looks happier Since it was placed in her cage. Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: chava Slotoroff

customer_reviews.title: Good for parrot chewing
customer_reviews.text: My bird started destroying it immediately, which is a good thing. My only complaint is that the post screw isn’t stable. The perch keeps turning even though it is firmly attached to the cage. The attached screw needs work on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Best perch for tired feet
customer_reviews.text: I.love these for my bird and he chooses them over his other perches. I had to buy more to rotate in while I clean them off because he is constantly on them
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Well made.
customer_reviews.text: These perches are solid, and well made. Important for my red bellied parrot to have access to as well as various widths of round perches of different textures. He seems to enjoy the flat surface.
customer_reviews.author: Irene Kraus

customer_reviews.title: My cockatiel likes them
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to mix things up in my cockatiels house. He seems to like them, didnt take long to warm up to them. The wood is dry, not damp-ish like other perches Ive bought on Amazon. I like that you get two as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Bee

customer_reviews.title: my finches loves this
customer_reviews.text: I put a feeding dish on it, they love it- this is my second time purchasing, and just so u know u can use either side the flat or the bark, super easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Great cage addition
customer_reviews.text: Great little platform perch. Helps you get birds not fully confident in their perching, but also offers a nice place for any age bird to hang out.
customer_reviews.author: Polymath

customer_reviews.title: Niteangel perch
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my new Cape Parrot and this is a very nice and sturdy product which also offers chewing potential for parrots that like to do that and mine does.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Eichman

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality perch
customer_reviews.text: Poor design. Bolt isnt glued into the perch or anything so you cant actually attach it to the cage. Very disappointing. Can probably fix it myself, but still - have to give a poor review.
customer_reviews.author: Ramanda Rox

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my marmoset monkeys cage they are perfect to set her bowl of food on or any snacks I may put in there. They are a little hard to clean but they are worth it. She loves having a place to sit to.
customer_reviews.author: happynana

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: My birds love them! As expected they got to chewing on them right away. One of them the bottom part of the wood is already coming apart but other than that glad I got the 2 pack. Worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Melody S.

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction
customer_reviews.text: Was really excited about these but ended being disappointed. One of the perches ended up falling because the screw came out of the plank, thankfully my Timneh African Grey wasn’t on it! I also wish the washers that came with it were bigger, their size made it to where I could attach it to my bird’s habitat in only a few places. Really wish the construction on these were better.
customer_reviews.author: Abbie

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than I expected and I love it! I put one in my cockatiels cage and in my budgies cage. Oliver loves chewing on it. It’s his favorite place to be lol. Also my budgies loves to take their naps there. 2-3 fit comfortably. ☺️ Will definitely but again!
customer_reviews.author: Mileidi Vanegas

customer_reviews.title: Natural wood
customer_reviews.text: Both our budgies love this. It’s a nice change from being perched up on a branch. Babs loves maintaining her beak on the bark; she’s always picking at it. Easy to clean; and move around to different spots.
customer_reviews.author: DKN

customer_reviews.title: Nice little perch for my parrot
customer_reviews.text: my little parrot has some foot damage and he seems to enjoy standing on this flat surface sometimes to alleviate having to grab tightly around a pole or stick in his cage.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond R Collins

customer_reviews.title: Buy this or replace this with the coarse covered platform ...
customer_reviews.text: Buy this or replace this with the coarse covered platform which my bird has contracted brumble foot from , the tiny sandpaper gets caught in their leg and feet and irritate them , you have to soak them in warm water and then oil them till well
customer_reviews.author: Robert M.

customer_reviews.title: Amazon loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Makes a great (and cheap) chew toy for an Amazon! Can be affixed to the side or the top of the cage for a satisfying, long-lasting chew.
customer_reviews.author: Victorine

customer_reviews.title: Awesome perch.
customer_reviews.text: Very thick and sturdy. Two washes with each perch. Great for Quakers and Conures as it allows a different size perch for their feet.
customer_reviews.author: Wild At Heart

customer_reviews.title: Good for Small/Medium Birds
customer_reviews.text: My two lovebirds instantly liked these platform perches. Made from natural wood so it’s safe for the bird to chew and the bottom still has the tree bark on it so if you position it right you get both a platform and a tree bark for you bird to tear up!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My zebra finches love this perch
customer_reviews.text: It is important to me to have flat surface perches as well as the classic smaller perches for my zebra finches for a variety and comfort for them. They love this perch and even sleep on it sometimes! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Took my cockateel months to actually use it.
customer_reviews.text: The cage perch looks great, but it took a while for us to catch the bird on it. He usually uses it to make his announcements or complaints (loud cheeping). I forgive him though since he's an old bird.
customer_reviews.author: Mostlee

customer_reviews.title: It is a perfect size.
customer_reviews.text: The piece I got has more of a thick, hairy bark. My cockatiels have been thrilled with it because it gives them something to pull apart. I alternate between the flat side and the bark side, to keep them interested. All of the edges and cuts are sanded so there are no splinters. It is a perfect size.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Gochnauer

customer_reviews.title: good idea not for a bird that chews!
customer_reviews.text: my cockatoo chewed this down to a round perch then ate the rest... but a delight for her to have a new toy for a week!
customer_reviews.author: lok

customer_reviews.title: Great perch and enrichment
customer_reviews.text: They are exactly as they should be. Varied surface, not too easy to chew but not so hard as to discourage healthy chewing behavior! Definitely ordering more.
customer_reviews.author: KSV

customer_reviews.title: GOOD QUALITY PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice solid good quality platform for a small to medium sized bird. Mine is a cockatiel and he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: gr8brit

customer_reviews.title: Must haves! Sturdy, fun, and gives their little feet some comfort
customer_reviews.text: So my birds love (and fight over) these perches. So great. Safe wood (my birds love to chew the bottom), and great entertainment. Real sturdy, bird lovers don’t think just buy lol. The only thing is that because it is thicker sometimes the bird may accidentally poop on it more often but it is so easy to wipe off and is like new again. Plus all bird toys should be cleaned on the regular anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Pauline Hewitt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great product, just what I was looking for and it's a really nice big size. My birds love to stand on it.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Second time purchasing
customer_reviews.text: My two cockatiel birds love these perches. This is the second time I buy them so they have more places to rest on.
customer_reviews.author: Margarita Llamas

customer_reviews.title: A different kind of perch
customer_reviews.text: My budgie Pippin has two of these wooden platforms, one inside his cage and one outside. He uses them every day in his wanderings. I like them for the way they exercise Pippin’s feet.
customer_reviews.author: J G Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Light weight wood. All natural.
customer_reviews.text: Very light wood. Doesn't stress the cage. Birds ate the bark immediately. Good value. Corners are nicely rounded off. Parakeets enjoy resting on it.
customer_reviews.author: Terry McKee

product_meta.title: Niteangel Parrot Cage Perch, Wooden Platform for Birds
product_meta.description:
Size:2 Packs
This perch fits in most cages with a horizontal bar spacing using wing nuts that come with the package. It satisfies your pets' natural instincts to preen, stretch, or nap on a branch. For your birds to stay in a healthy and hygienic environment, please clean their toys regularly like in every 2-3 weeks. First remove the perch from the cage. Then use a spray bottle and a small brush to clean it, and finally dries it under the sun.

Package includes: 1 x Bird Wooden Perch.

Notice: 
Please check the size of the perch before making a purchase in case the item is not suitable for your pet birds.
feature_bullets: Provides hours of active fun for your pet bird.
The unique shape of the perch provides excellent foot exercise, ideal for your birds to play and climb on.
Made of Natural Fir, suitable for chewing and gnawing that keep your parrot's beak shaped and conditioned.
Equipped with wing nuts, easy to install in a cage.
Dimension: 7-inch in length and 3-inch in width.
